intro: Bracteocarpus kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu bracteocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many tropical tree species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive bracts and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in montane forests and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
